title: Anglerfish

properties.name: description
properties.value: Anglerfish are food that heal varying amounts. This fish is obtained by cooking raw anglerfish, requiring 84 Cooking and yielding 230 Cooking experience when successful. Anglerfish always have a chance of burning on fires and ranges, making a burnt anglerfish, unless a Cooking cape or cooking gauntlets are equipped which can be used along with the Hosidius Kitchen to reduce burn chance further. The Cooking cape guarantees success while Cooking gauntlets stop them from being burned at level 98. Using the Cooking gauntlets with the Hosidius Kitchen stops them from burning at level 93, or 88 once the elite Kourend & Kebos Diary is completed.

content:
This article is about cooked anglerfish. For the raw form, see Raw anglerfish.
 This article has money making guides: Catching anglerfish, Cooking raw anglerfish.
Please add tips to the subpages, rather than the article below.
Anglerfish
Released7 January 2016 (Update)
MembersYes

Daily volume1,655,890
Loading...
Advanced data
Item ID13441

Anglerfish are food that heal varying amounts. This fish is obtained by cooking raw anglerfish, requiring 84 Cooking and yielding 230 Cooking experience when successful. Anglerfish always have a chance of burning on fires and ranges, making a burnt anglerfish, unless a Cooking cape or cooking gauntlets are equipped which can be used along with the Hosidius Kitchen to reduce burn chance further. The Cooking cape guarantees success while Cooking gauntlets stop them from being burned at level 98. Using the Cooking gauntlets with the Hosidius Kitchen stops them from burning at level 93, or 88 once the elite Kourend & Kebos Diary is completed.

The amount that anglerfish heal is dependent on the player's Hitpoints level. At level 93 or above, an anglerfish will heal 22, the same as a manta ray, dark crab, or tuna potato.

Anglerfish can also heal above maximum Hitpoints (making the maximum Hitpoints possible 121). Overheal does not apply if the player is in combat in a PvP area, whether with another player or a non-player character. Considering anglerfish heal 22 starting at 93 Hitpoints and can boost above the base Hitpoints level, they are considered one of the best foods in the game.

The amount of Hitpoints boosted from eating anglerfish follows this table:

Hitpoints level Health boost
1–19 3
20–24 4
25–29 6
30–39 7
40–49 8
50–59 11
60–69 12
70–74 13
75–79 15
80–89 16
90–92 17
93–99 22

Contents

  • 1 Formula for healing
  • 2 Creation
    • 2.1 Cooking chance
  • 3 Item sources
  • 4 Changes

Formula for healing[edit | edit source]

The health boosted/restored seems to follow this formula: Δ H e a l t h = ⌊ L e v e l × 1 10 ⌋ + C {\displaystyle \Delta Health=\lfloor Level\times {\frac {1}{10}}\rfloor +C}

Where Level is your base Hitpoints level and C is a variable, which differs depending on your Hitpoints level as the following table shows:

Hitpoints level C
10–24 2
25–49 4
50–74 6
75–92 8
93–99 13

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
23 September 2020
(update)

Anglerfish can now overheal while you are in combat on a Target World, provided that you are not in the Wilderness.

22 November 2018
(update)

Anglerfish no longer overheal if the player is in the Wilderness or on a PVP World or Bounty Hunter world where the player has been in combat or has recently been attacked by a player within the last 10 seconds.

[[File:Anglerfish detail.png|180px|left]]
'''Anglerfish''' are [[food]] that heal varying amounts. This [[fish]] is obtained by cooking [[raw anglerfish]], requiring 84 [[Cooking]] and yielding 230 Cooking [[experience]] when successful. Anglerfish always have a chance of burning on [[fire]]s and [[range]]s, making a [[burnt anglerfish]], unless a [[Cooking cape]] or [[cooking gauntlets]] are equipped which can be used along with the [[Hosidius Kitchen]] to reduce burn chance further. The Cooking cape guarantees success while Cooking gauntlets stop them from being burned at level 98. Using the Cooking gauntlets with the Hosidius Kitchen stops them from burning at level 93, or 88 once the [[elite Kourend & Kebos Diary]] is completed. 

The amount that anglerfish heal is dependent on the player's [[Hitpoints]] level. At level 93 or above, an anglerfish will heal 22, the same as a [[manta ray]], [[dark crab]], or [[tuna potato]].

Anglerfish can also heal above maximum Hitpoints (making the maximum Hitpoints possible 121). Overheal does not apply if the player is in combat in a [[PvP]] area, whether with another player or a non-player character. Considering anglerfish heal 22 starting at 93 Hitpoints and can boost above the base Hitpoints level, they are considered one of the best foods in the game.

The amount of Hitpoints boosted from eating anglerfish follows this table:
{| class="wikitable"
!{{SCP|Hitpoints|link=yes}} level
!Health boost
|-
|1–19||3
|-
|20–24||4
|-
|25–29||6
|-
|30–39||7
|-
|40–49||8
|-
|50–59||11
|-
|60–69||12
|-
|70–74||13
|-
|75–79||15
|-
|80–89||16
|-
|90–92||17
|-
|93–99||22
|}

==Formula for healing==
The health boosted/restored seems to follow this formula:
<math>\Delta Health = \lfloor Level \times \frac{1}{10} \rfloor + C</math>

Where Level is your base [[Hitpoints]] level and ''C'' is a variable, which differs depending on your Hitpoints level as the following table shows:
{| class="wikitable"
!{{SCP|Hitpoints|link=yes}} level
!C
|-
|10–24||2
|-
|25–49||4
|-
|50–74||6
|-
|75–92||8
|-
|93–99||13
|}
